description: The &lta&gt tag defines a hyperlink, which is used to link from one page to another. The most important attribute of the &lta&gt element is the href attribute, which indicates the link’s destination.
The abbr tag indicates an abbreviation or an acronym. By marking up abbreviations you can give useful information to browsers, spell checkers, translation systems and search-engine indexers.
Oops, this tag isn't supported in HTML5. We recommend looking into the &ltabbr&gt tag instead.
The &ltaddress&gt tag defines the contact information for the author/owner of a document or an article.
Oops, this tag isn't supported in HTML5. We recommend looking into the &ltapplet&gt tag instead.
The &ltarea&gt tag defines an area inside an image-map (an image-map is an image with clickable areas).
The &ltarticle&gt tag specifies independent, self-contained content. An article should make sense on its own and it should be possible to distribute it independently from the rest of the site.
The &ltaside&gt tag defines some content aside from the content it is placed in.
The &ltaudio&gt tag defines sound, such as music or other audio streams.
The &ltb&gt tag specifies bold text.
The &ltbase&gt tag specifies the base URL/target for all relative URLs in a document. There can be at maximum one &ltbase&gt element in a document, and it must be inside the &lthead&gt element.
Oops, this tag isn't supported in HTML5. Use CSS instead!
bdi stands for Bi-directional Isolation. The &ltbdi&gt tag isolates a part of text that might be formatted in a different direction from other text outside it.
bdo stands for Bi-Directional Override. The &ltbdo&gt tag is used to override the current text direction.
Oops, this tag isn't supported in HTML5. Use CSS instead!
The &ltblockquote&gt tag specifies a section that is quoted from another source. Browsers usually indent &ltblockquote&gt elements.
The &ltblockquote&gt tag specifies a section that is quoted from another source. Browsers usually indent &ltblockquote&gt elements.
The &ltbr&gt tag inserts a single line break. The &ltbr&gt tag is an empty tag which means that it has no end tag.
The &ltbutton&gt tag defines a clickable button. Tip: Always specify the type attribute for a &ltbutton&gt element. Different browsers use different default types for the &ltbutton&gt element.

The &ltcanvas&gt tag is used to draw graphics, on the fly, via scripting (usually JavaScript). The &ltcanvas&gt tag is only a container for graphics, you must use a script to actually draw the graphics.
The &ltcaption&gt tag defines a table caption. The &ltcaption&gt tag must be inserted immediately after the &lttable&gt tag.
Oops, this tag isn't supported in HTML5. Use CSS instead!
The &ltcite&gt tag defines the title of a work (e.g. a book, a song, a movie, a TV show, a painting, a sculpture, etc.).
The &ltcode&gt tag is a phrase tag. It defines a piece of computer code.
The &ltcol&gt tag specifies column properties for each column within a &ltcolgroup&gt element.
The &ltcolgroup&gt tag specifies a group of one or more columns in a table for formatting.
The &ltcommand&gt tag defines a command (a radiobutton, a checkbox, or a command button) that the user can invoke.
The &ltdatalist&gt tag specifies a list of pre-defined options for an &ltinput&gt element.
The &ltdd&gt tag is used to describe a term/name in a description list. The &ltdd&gt tag is used in conjunction with &ltdl&gt (defines a description list) and &ltdt&gt (defines terms/names).

The &ltdel&gt tag defines text that has been deleted from a document. Tip: Use &ltdel&gt and &ltins&gt to markup updates and modifications in a document. Browsers will normally strike a line through deleted text and underline inserted text.
The &ltdetails&gt tag specifies additional details that the user can view or hide on demand.
The &ltdfn&gt tag is a phrase tag. It defines a definition term.
The &ltdialog&gt tag defines a a dialog box, inpector, or window.
Oops, this tag isn't supported in HTML5. Use CSS instead!
The &ltdiv&gt tag defines a division or a section in an HTML document. The &ltdiv&gt tag is used to group block-elements to format them with CSS.
The &ltdl&gt tag defines a description list. The &ltdl&gt tag is used in conjunction with &ltdt&gt (defines terms/names) and &ltdd&gt (describes each term/name).
The &ltdt&gt tag defines a term/name in a description list. The &ltdt&gt tag is used in conjunction with &ltdl&gt (defines a description list) and &ltdd&gt (describes each term/name).
The &ltem&gt tag is a phrase tag. It renders as emphasized text.
The &ltembed&gt tag defines a container for an external application or interactive content (a plug-in).
The &ltfieldset&gt tag is used to group related elements in a form. The &ltfieldset&gt tag draws a box around the related elements.
The &ltfigcaption&gt tag defines a caption for a &ltfigure&gt element. The &ltfigcaption&gt element can be placed as the first or last child of the &ltfigure&gt element.
The &ltfigure&gt tag specifies self-contained content, like illustrations, diagrams, photos, code listings, etc.
Oops, this tag isn't supported in HTML5. Use CSS instead!
The &ltfooter&gt tag defines a footer for a document or section. A &ltfooter&gt element should contain information about its containing element.
The &ltform&gt tag is used to create an HTML form for user input.
Oops, this tag isn't supported in HTML5! (Frames are BAD!)
Oops, this tag isn't supported in HTML5! (Frames are BAD!)
The &lthead&gt element is a container for all the head elements. The &lthead&gt element must include a title for the document, and can include scripts, styles, meta information, and more.
The &ltheader&gt tag specifies a header for a document or section.
The &lth1&gt to &lth6&gt tags are used to define HTML headings.
The &lthr&gt tag defines a thematic break in an HTML page (e.g. a shift of topic). The &lthr&gt element is used to separate content (or define a change) in an HTML page.
The &lthtml&gt tag tells the browser that this is an HTML document.
The &lti&gt tag defines a part of text in an alternate voice or mood. The content of the &lti&gt tag is usually displayed in italic.
The &ltiframe&gt tag specifies an inline frame. An inline frame is used to embed another document within the current HTML document.
The &ltimg&gt tag defines an image in an HTML page. The &ltimg&gt tag has two required attributes: src and alt.
The &ltinput&gt tag specifies an input field where the user can enter data. &ltinput&gt elements are used within a &ltform&gt element to declare input controls that allow users to input data.
The &ltins&gt tag defines a text that has been inserted into a document.
The &ltkbd&gt tag is a phrase tag. It defines keyboard input.
The &ltkeygen&gt tag specifies a key-pair generator field used for forms. When the form is submitted, the private key is stored locally, and the public key is sent to the server.
The &ltlabel&gt tag defines a label for an &ltinput&gt element.
The &ltlegend&gt tag defines a caption for the &ltfieldset&gt element.
The &ltli&gt tag defines a list item. The &ltli&gt tag is used in ordered lists(&ltol&gt), unordered lists (&ltul&gt), and in menu lists (&ltmenu&gt).
The &ltlink&gt tag defines the relationship between a document and an external resource. The &ltlink&gt tag is most used to link to style sheets.
The &ltmap&gt tag is used to define a client-side image-map. An image-map is an image with clickable areas.
The &ltmark&gt tag defines marked text.
The &ltmenu&gt tag defines a list/menu of commands. The &ltmenu&gt tag is used for context menus, toolbars and for listing form controls and commands.
Metadata is data (information) about data.
The &ltmeter&gt tag defines a scalar measurement within a known range, or a fractional value. This is also known as a gauge.
The &ltnav&gt tag defines a set of navigation links.
Oops, this tag isn't supported in HTML5! (You shouldn't be using frames!)
The &ltnoscript&gt tag defines an alternate content for users that have disabled scripts in their browser or have a browser that doesn’t support script.
The &ltobject&gt tag defines an embedded object within an HTML document.
The &ltol&gt tag defines an ordered list. An ordered list can be numerical or alphabetical. Use the &ltli&gt tag to define list items.
The &ltoptgroup&gt is used to group related options in a drop-down list. If you have a long list of options, groups of related options are easier to handle for a user.
The &ltoption&gt tag defines an option in a select list. &ltoption&gt elements go inside a &ltselect&gt or &ltdatalist&gt element.
The &ltoutput&gt tag represents the result of a calculation (like one performed by a script).
The &ltp&gt tag defines a paragraph.
the &ltparam&gt tag is used to define parameters for plugins embedded with an &ltobject&gt element.
The &ltpre&gt tag defines preformatted text.
The &ltprogress&gt tag represents the progress of a task.
The &ltq&gt tag defines a short quotation. Browsers normally insert quotation marks around the quotation.
the &ltrp&gt tag defines what to show if a browser does NOT support ruby annotations.
The &ltrt&gt tag defines an explanation or pronunciation of characters in a ruby annotation.
The &ltruby&gt tag specifies a ruby annotation.
The &lts&gt tag specifies text that is no longer correct, accurate or relevant.
The &ltsamp&gt tag is a phrase tag. It defines sample output from a computer program.
The &ltscript&gt tag is used to define a client-side script, such as a JavaScript.
The &ltsection&gt tag defines sections in a document, such as chapters, headers, footers, or any other sections of the document.
The &ltselect&gt element is used to create a drop-down list.
The &ltsmall&gt tag defines smaller text (and other side comments).
The &ltsource&gt tag is used to specify multiple media resources for media elements, such as &ltvideo&gt and &ltaudio&gt.
The &ltspan&gt tag is used to group inline-elements in a document.
Oops, this tag isn't supported in HTML5. You should use CSS instead!
The &ltstrong&gt tag is a phrase tag. It defines important text.
The &ltstyle&gt tag is used to define style information for an HTML document.
The &ltsub&gt tag defines subscript text. Subscript text appears half a character below the baseline.
The &ltsummary&gt tag defines a visible heading for the &ltdetails&gt element. The heading can be clicked to view/hide the details.
The &ltsup&gt tag defines superscript text. Superscript text appears half a character above the baseline.
The &lttable&gt tag defines an HTML table. An HTML table consists of the &lttable&gt element and one or more &lttr&gt, &ltth&gt, and &lttd&gt elements.
The &lttbody&gt tag is used to group the body content in an HTML table.
The &lttd&gt tag defines a standard cell in an HTML table. The text in &lttd&gt elements are regular and left-aligned by default.
The &lttextarea&gt tag defines a multi-line text input control.
The &lttfoot&gt tag is used to group footer content in an HTML table.
The &ltth&gt tag defines a header cell in an HTML table. The text in &ltth&gt elements are bold and centered by default.
The &ltthead&gt tag is used to group header content in an HTML table.
The &lttime&gt tag defines either a time (24 hour clock), or a date in the Gregorian calendar, optionally with a time and a time-zone offset.
The &lttitle&gt tag is required in all HTML documents and it defines the title of the document.
The &lttr&gt tag defines a row in an HTML table. A &lttr&gt element contains one or more &ltth&gt or &lttd&gt elements.
The &lttrack&gt tag specifies text tracks for media elements (&ltaudio&gt and &ltvideo&gt).
The &ltu&gt tag represents some text that should be stylistically different from normal text, such as misspelled words or proper nouns in Chinese.
The &ltul&gt tag defines an unordered (bulleted) list. Use the &ltul&gt tag together with the &ltli&gt tag to create unordered lists.
The &ltvar&gt tag is a phrase tag. It defines a variable. Tip: This tag is not deprecated, but it is possible to achieve richer effect with CSS.
The &ltvideo&gt tag specifies video, such as a movie clip or other video streams. Currently, there are 3 supported video formats for the &ltvideo&gt element: MP4, WebM, and Ogg
The &ltwbr&gt (Word Break Opportunity) tag specifies where in a text it would be ok to add a line-break.
